Job Description About the roleArm’s Infrastructure line of business focuses on cloud computing and networking infrastructure opportunities, built on Arm’s leading instruction set architecture. Within the line of business, the go-to-market team’s role is to develop the programs, ecosystem, strategies, and OEM engagements to drive ARM’s rapidly growing business.Within this organization, you will lead the effort to develop a rapidly growing business in the enterprise/data center subsegment, including helping to identify the IP and ecosystem elements that enable Arm to have a boldly compelling solution to key OEMs, semiconductor partners, and others.You will drive development and execution of strategies for enterprise/data center networking. Key outcomes from this role include strategic sub-segment plans, ecosystem execution, semiconductor partner projects, PoCs, outbound and sales collateral, and OEM design wins.The critical objective for this role will be to collaborate with engineering, OEMs, and semiconductor partners to build a rapidly growing business including a compelling IP and ecosystem portfolio. Key actions will include driving the mid-to-long term vertical market strategy, building OEM pull, driving design wins versus daring architectures, supporting the market development of semiconductor and ecosystem partners, and working with sales to drive short-term licensing opportunities and long-term strategic engagements.What will I be accountable for?Collaborating with engineering, outbound marketing, sales, and others to develop subsegment analyses including market sizing, leading OEMs, competitive dynamics, and technology roadmap.Partnering with key ecosystem partners, including silicon, ecosystem, and hardware, to develop PoCs and solutions for end market application.Developing sales and marketing collateral plans and content to extend reach.Personal involvement in business development activities at key OEMs, semiconductor partners, and influencers.
